He is widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language, and he is the only author to have written works in all the major genres of literature. Charles Dickens.passage:

This year, to celebrate the bicentenary of Charles Dickens’ birth, English Heritage and the British Council are unveiling a new way of experiencing 12 of his novels and poems by placing famous locations from the stories at the centre of these special events. The launch will take place with a major international – and very personal – exhibition at the British Library in London on 10 December. And what a lot it is! From the Little Dorrit novel to Little Nell in Great Expectations, each of the stories was a product of Dickens’ imagination, and there are many locations in and around the UK that can help to illustrate how each of these were first conceived.
